Belajar Sejarah Islam, Marbut-Majelis Taklim DKI Kunjungi Masjid Abu Bakar-Ali
06 Nov 2019, 01:11 by Kanavino Ahmad Rizqo
Madinah - Tak hanya menunaikan ibadah, para marbut dan majelis taklim DKI Jakarta juga mempelajari sejarah Islam di Madinah. Mereka mengunjungi masjid bersejarah di sekitar Masjid Nabawi.
Jemaah awalnya Salat Asar di Masjid Nabawi. Setelah itu, rombongan berkumpul di pintu 16 kemudian berjalan bersama-sama menuju masjid yang dituju.
Masjid pertama yang dikunjungi adalah Masjid Ghamamah. Ada cerita penting di balik penamaan masjid yang dikenal sebagai masjid awan itu.
"Alhamdulillah setelah Salat Asar. Kami sebagai pendamping membawa jemaah, ziarah di sekitar Masjid Nabawi. Di antaranya kita berkunjung ke Masjid Ghamamah. Yang mana Masjid Ghamamah tersebut merupakan sebuah masjid yang dijadikan simbol sejarah bahwa di sana pernah terjadi sejarah Allah SWT menurunkan awan untuk memberi atau menutup para sahabat ketika mendengar khutbah Rasulullah. Yang mana kala itu Rasulullah dalam versi sejarah, lagi salat Istisqa ataupun Salat Lebaran, Salat Id. Sehingga di sana dibangun Masjid Ghamamah artinya masjid awan," kata pembimbing dari Sutra Tour, Ali Wardah, di Madinah, Arab Saudi, Selasa (5/11/2019).
Setelah itu, rombongan juga melakukan foto bersama di depan Masjid Abu Bakar. Menurut Ali, ada beragam versi mengenai sejarah penamaan masjid tersebut.
"Kita juga berpose menggunakan background Masjid Abu Bakar. Yang mana di sana ada yang mengatakan rumahnya Abu Bakar ataupun ada yang mengatakan salah satu versi sejarah saf nya Sayyidina Abu Bakar," ujar dia.


Jemaah Umrah Marbut dan Majelis Taklim DKI di Masjid Abu Bakar-Ali Foto: Kanavino/detikcom

Menurut Ali, Abu Bakar merupakan salat satu sahabat dekat Rasulullah SAW. Abu Bakar juga merupakan orang yang percaya tentang Isra Misraj Rasul.
"Yang mana Abu Bakar ini termasuk sahabat Rasul yang paling dekat dan orang pertama yang mengimani atau meyakini tentang Isra Misraj Baginda Rasulullah SAW ketika bertemu dengan Allah dan menerima perintah salat," ujar Ali.

Studying Islamic History, DKI Marbut-Majelis Taklim Visits Abu Bakar-Ali Mosque
Nov 6 2019, 01:11 by Kanavino Ahmad Rizqo
Madinah - Not only performing worship, the marbut and Jakarta taklim assemblies also study the history of Islam in Medina. They visited the historic mosque around the Nabawi Mosque.
The congregation was originally the Asar Prayer in the Nabawi Mosque. After that, the group gathered at the door 16 and then walked together to the destination mosque.
The first mosque visited was the Ghamamah Mosque. There is an important story behind the naming of the mosque known as the cloud mosque.
"Alhamdulillah after Asar Prayer. We as a companion brought pilgrims, pilgrimages around the Nabawi Mosque. Among them we visited the Ghamamah Mosque. The Ghamamah Mosque is a mosque which is used as a historical symbol that there has been a history of Allah SWT lowering the clouds to give or close the Companions when they hear the Prophet's sermon. Which was then the Messenger of God in the historical version, again Istisqa Prayer or Eid Prayer, Id Prayer. So that there was built Ghamamah Mosque means a cloud mosque, "said the guide of the Sutra Tour, Ali Wardah, in Medina. , Saudi Arabia, Tuesday (5/11/2019).
After that, the group also took a group photo in front of the Abu Bakar Mosque. According to Ali, there are various versions regarding the history of naming the mosque.
"We also posed using the background of the Abu Bakr Mosque. Which one said there was the house of Abu Bakr or some said one of the saf historical versions of Sayyidina Abu Bakr," he said.


Marbut Umrah Congregation and DKI Taklim Assembly at Abu Bakar-Ali Mosque Photo: Kanavino / detikcom

According to Ali, Abu Bakr was a prayer of a close friend of the Prophet. Abu Bakr was also a person who believed about Isra Misraj Rasul.
"Which Abu Bakr is among the closest friends of the Prophet and the first person to believe in or believe in Isra Misraj, His Majesty the Prophet when he met with Allah and received the command to pray," Ali said.
